plugins.name: xliff-translate
plugins.description:
You know the situation, you have spent hours placing all text in Figma, arranged everything nicely, checked it several times with the people in charge, made the last corrections and everyone is happy and satisfied? Task accomplished! Then someone is asking for all the text you have in your Figma because it needs to be translated. Easy right?


If your translation service provider works with xliff, you now have a solution. With xliff-translate you can export all text layers to a file which then can be translated and if needed, imported again into Figma.


Features


You can choose to export a selection of layers, a page, or the entire document. __Note that the more layers you export, the longer it will take to process.__


If you have selected the entire document for export, you can decide whether to export the layers per page or all merged into the XLIFF document. Default is "merged".

Example. You have used the phrase "Hello World" on several pages. If you select the "Merge layers" option, this sentence will appear only once in the XLIFF document and will have to be translated only once. Without this option, the sentence will appear separately on each page on which it appears.


Locked and hidden layers are not exported by default.


In addition to the XLIFF document, you can also specify whether you want to export images. If this option is selected, you will receive a ZIP file containing the images and an XLIFF document. The outermost layer in which the text is located will be exported. For texts without surrounding elements on the page, no images will be exported.


Importing an XLIFF document is simple. Load it either by clicking the Import XLIFF button and selecting the file on your computer, or by dropping the file onto the Import button.

You can choose what happens if any text is not translated in the XLIFF document. Either this entry is ignored or the empty text is imported and the original text is deleted.


WARNING!!

If you have more than one text style in one text layer only the first style will be used for the imported text!
plugins.tagline: Export text from your Figma file to an easy-to-translate XLIFF document

plugins.name: QR Code Builder
plugins.description:
Transform your design experience with the QR Code Builder for Figma. This versatile plugin empowers designers to create custom, high-quality QR codes directly within Figma, enhancing your projects with seamless connectivity and aesthetic appeal.


Features:


  • Website URL Integration: Easily generate QR codes that direct users to any website URL, enhancing accessibility and user engagement.
  • Advanced Customization Options: Tailor your QR codes to perfectly match your design vision with a range of customization features:


  1. Color: Choose from an unlimited color palette to make your QR codes stand out.
  2. Style Logo: Incorporate your brand’s logo into the QR code for a cohesive and professional look.
  3. Shape: Customize the shape of your QR codes to complement your design elements.
  4. Corners: Add a unique touch by modifying the corner shapes of your QR codes.
  5. Border Style: Select from various border styles to enhance the visual appeal of your QR codes.
  6. Center Style: Apply different center styles to make your QR codes truly unique.


  • File Upload Capability: Embed files directly into your QR codes, providing users with instant access to additional content.
  • License Management: Enjoy flexibility with our free tier or upgrade to unlimited usage, ensuring continuous and unrestricted access to all features.
  • Effortless QR Code Creation: Generate high-quality QR codes with a user-friendly interface designed for efficiency and ease of use.
  • Upgrade Notifications: Stay informed about your usage limits with clear notifications, and upgrade seamlessly when needed.
  • Dedicated Customer Support: Access our support team for any assistance, including license management and troubleshooting.


Why Choose QR Code Builder?


Enhance your designs with interactive QR codes that are not only functional but also visually appealing. Whether you're directing users to a website, embedding files, or customizing the aesthetics, the QR Code Builder provides a comprehensive solution tailored to your needs.


Get Started Today!


Download and Install the QR Code Builder from the Figma Community Store and elevate your design projects with the power of customizable QR codes.
plugins.tagline: Create, Customize, and Integrate Stunning QR Codes Seamlessly with QR Code Builder for Figma.

#これは何？

選択したフレームをレスポンシブ展開してくれるプラグイン。

by ふるじゅん


#手順

1.プラグインを起動

2.ちゃんと崩れないように組んでる Frame を1つ選択

3.展開したい Viewport width をカンマ区切りで入力

4.「展開」ボタンを押下


---

A plugin that expands the selected frame responsively.

by Furujun

1. Start the plugin

2. Select a Frame that is properly assembled and does not collapse

3. Enter the viewport width you want to expand, separated by commas

4. Press the "展開" button

plugins.name: fig2tw - Convert variables to Tailwind, CSS or JSON
plugins.description:
Convert Figma variables into a Tailwind plugin, CSS or JSON file.


Key features:

Tailwind configuration is inferred from the variable scopes.

Configure the variable scopes in Figma to generate useful Tailwind configuration.

<div class="bg-primary text-on-primary rounded-sm gap-md p-xs">
The background color is given by the variable "color/primary".
The text color is given by the variable "color/on primary".
The border-radius is given by the variable "radius/sm".
The gap is given by the variable "space/md".
The padding is given by the variable "space/xs".
</div>


All variable modes are converted into CSS variables.

Change the mode (light, dark, etc.) with a CSS class.

<div class="theme-light">Figma's light mode variables are applied here</div>
<div class="theme-dark">Figma's dark mode variables are applied here.</div>


Number units are configured by variable scope.

Define how numbers are to converted to CSS. You can choose from px, em, rem. Font weights don't have units.


Getting started:

1. Download the generated Tailwind plugin

Download the tailwind plugin using the "Download" button and place the file next to your tailwind.config.ts.


2. Import the generated plugin in your Tailwind configuration

In the tailwind.config.ts file, import the generated plugin and place it in the plugins array. The configuration should look like below.

import fig2tw from "tailwind.fig2tw";
const config = {
plugins: [fig2tw],
// ...
}
export default config;


Supports:

Tailwind configuration scopes:

colors, fill, accentColor, backgroundColor, gradientColorStops, borderColor, stroke, ringColor, ringOffsetColor, outlineColor, textColor, textDecorationColor, caretColor, placeholderColor, boxShadowColor.

spacing, size, width, minWidth, maxWidth, height, minHeight, maxHeight, margin, inset, borderRadius, padding, gap, space, scrollMargin, scrollPadding, borderSpacing, strokeWidth, outlineWidth, borderWidth, ringWidth, fontFamily, fontSize, lineHeight, letterSpacing, fontWeight


Figma variables scopes:

ALL_SCOPES, ALL_FILLS, FRAME_FILL, SHAPE_FILL, TEXT_FILL, STROKE_COLOR, EFFECT_COLOR, CORNER_RADIUS, WIDTH_HEIGHT, GAP, STROKE_FLOAT, FONT_SIZE, LINE_HEIGHT, LETTER_SPACING, FONT_WEIGHT, FONT_FAMILY
plugins.tagline: Convert variables into a Tailwind plugin, CSS or JSON

plugins.name: Import Figma brand guideline designs into Corebook° — online brand guidelines platform
plugins.description:
Corebook° Figma Plugin


Streamline how designers connect their work with the brand.


The Corebook° Figma plugin makes it easy to import Figma-designed brand guideline modules directly into Corebook°, with instant update push functionality. It also supports two-way integration—allowing you to seamlessly import and export brand assets, color palettes, and typography between Corebook° and Figma.


What can this plugin do?


Figma frames. In Corebook°. Instantly.

With a single click bring your custom design Figma content framers into fully functional Corebook° modules– without the need of exporting, uploading or file conversions. Every design element is transferred pixel-perfect and still retains text recognition for easy select-copy, adding hover state asset or attaching assets for download.


Real-time updates, zero re-exports.

Seamlessly sync your Figma content frames with Corebook°—no extra steps, no re-uploads. Updating an existing module takes just one click, keeping everything effortlessly up to date.


Your assets, ready in Figma.

Designers in Figma can now access all brand assets directly from the Corebook° Asset Library—no switching tabs, no extra steps. Keep design and non-design teams aligned with a single source of truth for every brand asset.


Your designs, saved where they belong.

Not adding live content frames? No problem. Export your Figma designs—or just specific elements—straight to the Corebook° Asset Library, all without leaving Figma.


Brand styles, applied instantly.

Forget manual brand typography and color style setups—create local Figma styles automatically from your brand guidelines on Corebook°. No more redoing what’s already done. No more human errors.


Getting started with the Corebook° x Figma Plugin


To begin, create a project in Corebook° and link it with your Figma file through the plugin interface on Figma. Then follow two step process to get started your brand designs:


Designing in Figma – create your brand guidelines module using a Figma content frame from the plugin dashboard. This is where the content you’ll bring into Corebook° will be.


Set up a Figma module in Corebook° – Inside your Corebook° project, create a Figma module—this is where your design from Figma will be displayed.


Layout Size Recommendations

When not using placeholder content frames, then for the best results, please keep these layout size recommendations in mind:

  1. Desktop layout width: 1070px
  2. Mobile layout width: 375px


Or create a custom column size within a multi-column grid. Check Figma module placeholders in the Corebook° Editor for specific sizing guidance.


For any questions or feedback please contact us: figma@corebook.io


---

Corebook° is an online brand guidelines platform that gets your branding processes in order and means business.
plugins.tagline: Build guidelines, import brand assets, and create local Figma styles automatically!

plugins.name: MockMaster AI
plugins.description:
Generate Realistic-looking mock data with AI


MockMaster AI was crafted to generate mock data that perfectly fits narrow workflows and real-world scenarios where data isn't always available. Whether you need company-specific details, app-related information, or something entirely unique, this tool uses AI to create it for you. And don’t worry—it's currently free, until i drain my savings.


It also has tons of pre-filled data which can be generated by selecting any number of text frames.


How to Use :


  1. Select any text layers.
  2. Open the plugin and choose from the pre-filled data options to populate the text layers with data that match your needs.
  3. If the data you need isn't available in the pre-filled options, select the text layers and enter your prompt in "Replace AI." The AI will generate the data for you.


Key Features:


  1. Includes 20+ realistic looking data, categorized by filters.
  2. Generate AI data based on your needs with just a single prompt.
  3. Generate AI images such as avatars or any custom generations
  4. Can select any number of frames for text updation
  5. All AI generations are free to use for now.


RoadMap :

  1. More pre-filled data
  2. Bring your own API Key - Shipped
plugins.tagline: Generate realistic-looking mock data for your designs with the power of AI.

  3. If the data you need isn't available in the pre-filled options, select the text layers and enter your prompt in "Replace AI." The AI will generate the data for you.


Key Features:


  1. Includes 20+ realistic looking data, categorized by filters.
  2. Generate AI data based on your needs with just a single prompt.
  3. Generate AI images such as avatars or any custom generations
  4. Can select any number of frames for text updation
  5. All AI generations are free to use for now.


RoadMap :

  1. More pre-filled data
  2. Bring your own API Key - Shipped

plugins.name: WeaveFox.ai - AI Powered Figma/Image to Code (React, Vue, Antd，& more)
plugins.description:
WeaveFox is an intelligent front-end development platform designed for the AI era. Built upon the Ant Bailing multimodal large model, it can directly generate front-end source code from design mockups, delivering a development experience characterized by high quality, efficiency, and productivity. The platform currently supports various mainstream application types, including enterprise-level back-office systems, mobile H5 pages, mini-programs, and mobile card-based applications.

Core Features

Image-to-Code

Description: The Image-to-Code feature uses multimodal recognition technology to convert images or design drafts into front-end source code, suitable for multiple endpoints. It supports back-office systems, mini-programs, mobile cards, and other application types, meeting the responsive layout needs of different devices.

Highlights:

  1. Adapts to multiple application types, including back-office systems, mini-programs, and mobile platforms
  2. Generates complete code structures directly from design mockups or screenshots, improving development efficiency

Multi-Technology Stack Support

Description: The multi-end code generation capability allows users to flexibly generate code for multiple platforms based on a single asset, thereby accommodating a variety of application scenarios. This significantly enhances code reuse and reduces repetitive workload. The feature supports React, Vue, Ant Design, Element UI, and card-based technology stacks.

Highlights:

  1. Generate multi-end code from a single source
  2. Improve code reuse and adapt to various endpoints and layouts

Automatic Design Partitioning

Description: The automatic page partitioning feature intelligently segments an entire design page into modular code assets. Each generated code block can be independently exported, making it well-suited for modular management and reuse in projects.

Highlights:

  1. Automatically divides an entire page into manageable code blocks
  2. Supports independent export of each code block

Semantics and Reusability

Description:

  1. The "Repeat" recognition feature automatically identifies repetitive or similar UI elements within the code and optimizes them during code generation, reducing redundancy and improving code quality and maintainability.
  2. Loop extraction for structured repetition.
  3. High-order component extraction for enhanced encapsulation.

Highlights:

  1. Identifies similar and repeated UI components
  2. Automatically optimizes repetitive code to streamline and simplify codebases

Automatic Image Cutting & Upload

Description:

  1. The automatic image cutting and upload feature detects image components within the generated code and automatically slices and uploads them. This greatly reduces manual cutting tasks, making the development process more seamless.
  2. Automatic icon recognition and matching.

Highlights:

  1. Automatically identifies and slices image areas, then uploads them
  2. Eliminates manual image slicing operations, saving time

Convenient Export & Integration

Description: The code export feature enables flexible exporting or copying of generated code, allowing users to easily integrate code assets into their development projects. Multiple export formats are provided, facilitating integration with different technology stacks. Integration with code repository services also enables one-click merge request creation.

Highlights:

  1. Supports flexible code export or copying
  2. Adapts to various technology stacks and project requirements

Asset Management

Description: The asset library function stores and manages generated code assets in a centralized manner. Users can view, adjust, and export generated code from the asset library. Each generated code snippet or UI element is treated as an “asset” that can be edited, regenerated, and flexibly exported as needed. This makes it easy to refine and re-edit code assets on demand.

Highlights:

  1. Provides a unified code management space
  2. Supports viewing, modifying, and exporting code assets for reuse
  3. Allows multiple edits and regenerations of each asset
  4. Offers flexible code export for project integration
plugins.tagline: Generate code from Figma design files with AI

plugins.name: Language Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin seamlessly integrates with Figma, enabling you to import translation files directly into your variable collections. With support for both JSON and ResX file formats, this tool is versatile enough to work with popular translation systems like Weblate, i18n, and others.


Once installed, the plugin allows you to effortlessly bring all the keys and values from your project's translation system into Figma, converting them into variables with their corresponding values and keys. This feature ensures that your design can adapt to various languages with accuracy and ease, making it an invaluable asset for creating globally accessible applications and websites.


Updating your translations is as straightforward as re-importing your updated translation file. The plugin intelligently updates the variables in Figma to reflect the latest changes, ensuring your design remains synchronized with your project's evolving linguistic requirements. This eliminates the need for manual updates, saving you time and reducing the potential for errors.


Whether you're working on a small project or a large-scale application, our plugin is designed to streamline your workflow, enhance collaboration between designers and developers, and ensure a seamless integration of multi-language support in your designs. It's the perfect tool for anyone looking to efficiently manage translations within Figma.
plugins.tagline: Instant Translation Import for Figma Designs.

plugins.name: File Health Check
plugins.description:

  • Groups / Frames that have only 1 element (and no stylings)

Warnings :

plugins.description:

Key Features (100% Free):

  1. Batch compression and export support
  2. Compatible with JPG, PNG and WebP formats
  3. Multiple compression levels (None/Light/Medium/Extreme)
  4. Various export scales (1x/2x/3x/4x)
  5. Before/after file size comparison
  6. Processing time tracking
  7. Automatic ZIP packaging for multiple files
  8. Suffix toggle switch for exported file names
  9. Smart compression based on image size
  10. Multi-threaded parallel processing
  11. Pure JavaScript implementation with local processing
  12. No usage limits or premium features


Everything is free - no hidden costs, no premium features, just a focused tool for the design community.

Meet Blinko! 👋🏻


Blinko is the first plugin for Figma and FigJam, designed with your health and productivity in mind. It helps improve your eyesight and prevent eye strain with just a few minutes of daily use.


How to use Blinko?

  1. In Figma or FigJam, go to the plugin menu and run the Blinko plugin
  2. Set a timer based on your availability
  3. Collapse the plugin
  4. When the time runs out, repeat the exercises and follow the instructions
  5. Take a 2-4 hour break between exercises
  6. Exercise three times a day regularly


Why use Blinko?

Blinko can help improve your vision and combat issues such as:

  1. Eye strain
  2. Burning eyes
  3. Headaches
  4. Blurred vision
  5. Difficulty focusing
  6. Sore eyes
  7. Eye twitching
  8. Double vision
  9. Tired eyes
  10. Dry eyes
  11. Itchy eyes

... and many other eye-related problems.


Unlock full power with Pro! 💎

Elevate your experience to the next level and unlock unlimited monthly uses. Get your Pro license here -> https://pro.blinko.io/

plugins.name: Swap Instance
plugins.description:
This is a simple little plugin that allows you to select a source instance and apply it to a destination instance (in the same way the swap instance panel works) but also optionally preserving some of the of the overrides.


This is a game changer when working with slots to allow you to insert a configured instance into an existing slot without having to manually reconfigure it.


How to use it.

  1. Select an instance or a component layer.
  2. Press the middle + button to "copy" the layer
  3. Select where you would like to "paste" the instance
  4. Press the right replace button


Settings

  • Persistent? Keeps the panel open after pasting
  • Create? If the source layer is not a component, the plugin will create a component of it when pasting
  • Deep Copy? This will attempt to copy any overrides on the source instance
plugins.tagline: Swap instances in the canvas while preserving overrides

plugins.name: Text Contrast Checker (APCA WCAG3)
plugins.description:
APCA Contrast Checker evaluates text accessibility using the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) for WCAG 3. Unlike traditional WCAG 2 tools, it provides more perceptually accurate assessments by considering font size, weight, and purpose to ensure truly readable designs.


APCA Contrast Checker for WCAG 3

The APCA Contrast Checker plugin brings the next generation of accessibility standards to Figma, implementing the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) developed for WCAG 3 (formerly known as "Silver").


Why APCA Instead of WCAG 2?

Traditional contrast ratios used in WCAG 2 have significant limitations - they treat all color pairs equally regardless of their perceptual differences, often allowing unreadable dark color combinations to "pass" while flagging perfectly readable light combinations as "failures."


APCA solves these problems by:

  1. Accounting for human perception of contrast based on modern vision research
  2. Considering text properties (size, weight, purpose) when determining readability
  3. Providing appropriate contrast levels for different reading scenarios
  4. Delivering more accurate evaluations for both light and dark modes


Key Features

  1. Text Property Analysis: Automatically detects and evaluates font size, weight, and color
  2. Context-Aware Evaluation: Adjusts contrast requirements based on text purpose (body text, headings, UI labels, or non-text elements)
  3. Conformance Levels: Indicates both Bronze (general) and Silver (detailed) level compliance
  4. WCAG 2 Compatibility: Shows approximate WCAG 2 ratio equivalents for reference
  5. Visual Contrast Meter: Displays contrast levels with an intuitive visual indicator
  6. Detailed Recommendations: Provides specific guidance to improve readability
  7. Interactive Controls: Adjust text properties and see results in real-time
  8. Font Size Guidance: Includes minimum font size recommendations based on contrast level and weight


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer in your Figma design
  2. The plugin will automatically evaluate the contrast between the text and its background
  3. Adjust font size, weight, or purpose using the controls to see how they affect compliance
  4. Use the recommendations to improve accessibility
  5. Swap text and background colors with one click to test inverse color schemes


About APCA and Conformance Levels

APCA provides two conformance levels:

  1. Bronze Level: General guidelines suitable for basic contrast evaluation without reference to lookup tables.
  2. Silver Level: More detailed requirements using font size and weight lookup tables for greater accuracy and flexibility.


This plugin implements the full APCA algorithm (Beta 0.1.9 G-4g) and follows the official lookup tables published by Myndex Research, the developers of APCA.


Upgrade your accessibility workflow with perceptually accurate contrast checking that goes beyond simple ratios to ensure your designs are truly readable for all users.
plugins.tagline: Text accessibility, scientifically measured! WCAG3

133075.name: Text Contrast Checker (APCA WCAG3)
133075.description:
APCA Contrast Checker evaluates text accessibility using the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) for WCAG 3. Unlike traditional WCAG 2 tools, it provides more perceptually accurate assessments by considering font size, weight, and purpose to ensure truly readable designs.


APCA Contrast Checker for WCAG 3

The APCA Contrast Checker plugin brings the next generation of accessibility standards to Figma, implementing the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) developed for WCAG 3 (formerly known as "Silver").


Why APCA Instead of WCAG 2?

Traditional contrast ratios used in WCAG 2 have significant limitations - they treat all color pairs equally regardless of their perceptual differences, often allowing unreadable dark color combinations to "pass" while flagging perfectly readable light combinations as "failures."


APCA solves these problems by:

  1. Accounting for human perception of contrast based on modern vision research
  2. Considering text properties (size, weight, purpose) when determining readability
  3. Providing appropriate contrast levels for different reading scenarios
  4. Delivering more accurate evaluations for both light and dark modes


Key Features

  1. Text Property Analysis: Automatically detects and evaluates font size, weight, and color
  2. Context-Aware Evaluation: Adjusts contrast requirements based on text purpose (body text, headings, UI labels, or non-text elements)
  3. Conformance Levels: Indicates both Bronze (general) and Silver (detailed) level compliance
  4. WCAG 2 Compatibility: Shows approximate WCAG 2 ratio equivalents for reference
  5. Visual Contrast Meter: Displays contrast levels with an intuitive visual indicator
  6. Detailed Recommendations: Provides specific guidance to improve readability
  7. Interactive Controls: Adjust text properties and see results in real-time
  8. Font Size Guidance: Includes minimum font size recommendations based on contrast level and weight


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer in your Figma design
  2. The plugin will automatically evaluate the contrast between the text and its background
  3. Adjust font size, weight, or purpose using the controls to see how they affect compliance
  4. Use the recommendations to improve accessibility
  5. Swap text and background colors with one click to test inverse color schemes


About APCA and Conformance Levels

APCA provides two conformance levels:

  1. Bronze Level: General guidelines suitable for basic contrast evaluation without reference to lookup tables.
  2. Silver Level: More detailed requirements using font size and weight lookup tables for greater accuracy and flexibility.


This plugin implements the full APCA algorithm (Beta 0.1.9 G-4g) and follows the official lookup tables published by Myndex Research, the developers of APCA.


Upgrade your accessibility workflow with perceptually accurate contrast checking that goes beyond simple ratios to ensure your designs are truly readable for all users.
133075.release_notes:
• Implemented APCA algorithm (Beta 0.1.9 G-4g) for perceptually accurate contrast evaluation
• Added automatic text property detection (color, size, weight)
• Included detailed Bronze and Silver conformance level analysis
• Provided font size recommendations based on APCA lookup tables
• Added interactive controls for text properties adjustment
• Included WCAG 2 equivalence indicators for backward compatibility
• Enhanced visual UI with contrast meter and live text preview
• Added detailed recommendations for improving text accessibility

plugins.name: 调色师 Color Palette Filler
plugins.description:
Introduction

“Color Palette Filler” allows you to quickly apply colors from a predefined palette to any selected element in Figma. Simplify your design workflow by adding vibrant colors with just a click.


Function Description

•Predefined color groups: 8 colors, 12 colors, 16 colors, 20 colors, 24 colors, 28 colors, 32 colors.

•Instantly apply selected colors to the fill of elements.

•User-friendly interface for quick access to your color needs.


How to Use

1.Select one or more elements in Figma.

2.Open the “Color Palette Filler” plugin.

3.Click on any color from the palette to apply it to the selected elements.


Notes

•Make sure the selected elements can accept fill properties.

•The plugin applies solid colors only.


介绍

“Color Palette Filler” 插件允许您快速将预定义色板中的颜色应用于 Figma 中的任何选定元素。只需点击一下，即可轻松为设计添加丰富的颜色，简化您的设计工作流程。


功能说明

•预定义的颜色分组：8色、12色、16色、20色、24色、28色、32色。

•即时将选定颜色应用于元素的填充。

•用户友好的界面，可快速访问您的颜色需求。


使用方法

1.在 Figma 中选择一个或多个元素。

2.打开 “Color Palette Filler” 插件。

3.点击色板中的任意颜色，将其应用于选定的元素。


注意事项

•请确保选定的元素可以接受填充属性。

•插件仅应用纯色。

plugins.name: Translator PRO DeepL
plugins.description:
Translator PRO – the ultimate Figma plugin that revolutionizes design localization! Translate your Figma designs seamlessly while preserving all styles associated with texts and paragraphs using our powerful algorithm.


🌐 Key Features:


Preserve Styles: Our advanced algorithm ensures that your text styles and paragraph formatting stay intact during translation.


Effortless Translation: Quickly translate any free text within your Figma designs with just a few clicks.


Custom Glossaries: Add or delete glossaries to DeepL, enhancing the accuracy of your translations.


Formality Level: Tailor your translations with the ability to choose the desired formality level for your content.



🚀 How to Use:


Install Translator PRO plugin for Figma.


Fill in the plugin account form to get started.


Create an account on DeepL and get your API key : https://www.deepl.com/pro/change-plan#developer


you can profit from 500,000 characters/month for free.


Enter your API key in the plugin settings.


Select the text layers / pages you want to translate


Choose your translation options, including glossaries and formality level (optional).


Click 'Translate' and watch as your designs get localized instantly!


⚙️ Settings:


Customize glossaries to match your specific terminology.

Adjust formality levels to suit the tone of your content.


Streamline your design localization process with Translator PRO – where translation meets precision, and styles are always preserved. Download now for a seamless multilingual design experience!



👉 We offer a usage based trial , up to 10 free translations. When reaching the limit a subscription is needed ( you will be redirected to the subscription page)


👉 We charge a 3.5$/month fee , mostly used to pay for our infrastructure , payment is handled via FastSpring.


👉 Our backend is hosted on AWS , we don't save any user private / public data even temporarily



Showcase : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XsZBHet9vAc

plugins.name: Variables2Flutter
plugins.description:
Flutter Code Generator for Figma


Transform your Figma design variables into clean, organized Flutter code effortlessly with the Flutter Code Generator plugin. This powerful tool seamlessly converts your local variables, including Colors, Strings, Numbers, and Booleans, into structured Flutter code, ready to integrate into your development workflow.


Main Features:

- Exports Figma Variables (Color, String, Boolean, Number).

- Exports TextStyles and Shadows, and works with Figma Variables.

- Exports Local Colors, Linear Gradients, and Radial Gradients, all of which work with Figma Variables.

- Generates easily accessible Classes without having to use Context or tools.

- No need to create logic to rebuild the screen when changing from Light to Dark (or the mode that is in the Figma collection).

- Automatically creates documentation when generating the code.

- In addition to having customization options for generating the code.

- AND THE BEST: IT HAS AN ANIMATION EFFECT WHEN SWITCHING THEMES!!!! 😎


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Code Generation: Instantly convert Figma's local variables into Flutter code with just a few clicks.
  2. Variable Support: Includes support for Colors, Strings, Numbers, and Booleans, ensuring a comprehensive export of your design tokens.
  3. Preset Modes: Utilize preset modes to customize how variables are named and categorized in the generated code, matching your project’s naming conventions and coding standards.
  4. Easy Integration: The generated code is organized and ready to be integrated into your Flutter project, streamlining the design-to-development process.
  5. Customizable Naming: Adapt the output to your needs with customizable naming conventions for variables, making the code more intuitive and aligned with your project's requirements.


Quick start:

  1. Open design in figma
  2. Open plugin Variables2Flutter
  3. On the plugin screen, make your adjustments to your preference.
  4. Click in generate
  5. Copy code generate
  6. Open new dart file in your project
  7. Paste code generate
  8. On top of your MaterialApp add FigmaTheme widget
  9. In the Figma Theme widget there are static functions for you to change the "Modes" of the collections' themes.
  10. Each collection will have a get variable in the file for you to retrieve the data, and when the collection changes mode, the widget will rebuild automatically. Example of a get variable:
ColorStylesDefault get ColorStyles {
return _ColorStyles.value;
}


Simplify your design-to-code workflow with the Flutter Code Generator for Figma and enhance your productivity by bridging the gap between design and development.

plugins.name: SSelect
plugins.description:
Make quick selections in Quick Actions. ✨


Extending the built in "Select all with ..." commands and without the need to open ui, all happens in Quick Actions!


✨ New:

  • Select with same text content
  • Select child
  • Select sibling
  • Select root


🀄 Core:

  • Select with conditions
  • Search and select


🎯 Select with conditions:

Select nodes with same types, names, or main components becomes few keys away.


Root:

  • Select root item (new)

Instance:

  • Select all instances within parent item
  • Select all instances within root item
  • Select all instances

Type:

  • Select all with same type within parent item
  • Select all with same type within root item
  • Select all with same type

Name:

  • Select all with same name within parent item
  • Select all with same name within root item
  • Select all with same name

Text content: (new)

  • Select all with same text content within parent item
  • Select all with same text content within root item
  • Select all with same text content

Child: (new)

  • Select first child
  • Select last child
  • Select target order

Sibling: (new)

  • Select prev sibling
  • Select next sibling

plugins.name: Color Contrast Grid for Figma variables
plugins.description:
Ensure your designs are accessible and inclusive with the power of automated color analysis! The Color Contrast Grid for Figma variables plugin reviews your Figma color variables to create a comprehensive contrast matrix that simplifies accessibility checks.


Key Benefits:

  1. Automatic Variable Scanning: Seamlessly analyzes your Figma color variables, eliminating manual input and making it easy to assess all color combinations in your design system.


  1. Detailed Contrast Ratios: Generates a matrix showing the contrast ratios between background and foreground color variables to identify potential accessibility issues.


  1. AA/AAA Compliance Indicators: Clearly marks which combinations meet WCAG AA and AAA standards, empowering you to meet accessibility guidelines effortlessly.


  1. Color-Coded Visualization: Presents results in an intuitive format, complete with color swatches, text previews, and clear labels for quick identification.


  1. Flexible for any Design System: Handles different variable structures and groups, from small projects to expansive design systems, adapting to your workflow seamlessly.


Ideal for UX/UI designers aiming to build accessible, WCAG-compliant designs with minimal effort and maximum efficiency. Integrate accessibility checks into your design process by harnessing the full power of your Figma variables.


* Current Limitations *

  1. Does not support alpha values
  2. Only supports WCGA color contrast calculations (no support for apca calculations)


I will work on those limitations and hopefully release new versions from time to time that support alpha values, modes and APAC color contrast calculations.

plugins.name: Slide Watermark
plugins.description:
A plugin for quickly adding watermarks, which has the following capabilities:

  1. Add text watermarks or image watermarks.
  2. If you don't want the watermarks, click the Remove button to quickly delete all watermarks.
  3. it is able to set common watermark properties: transparency, rotation angle, the distance between watermarks, and the distance between watermarks and the page edges.
  4. For text watermarks, you can select the font, font size, and color.
  5. Support only add watermark to selected slides


If you want to add watermark to your slides before exporting, you can add watermark first, export it and then remove the watermark, it will not change your slides content.


Come and try this plugin! If you have any good suggestions, you are welcome to share your ideas!

plugins.name: SparkUI
plugins.description:
SparkUI is your ultimate Figma plugin designed to streamline and elevate your design process.


Powered by cutting-edge AI, SparkUI empowers designers to create, iterate, and deliver stunning designs faster than ever.


Whether you're a seasoned professional or just starting out, SparkUI brings simplicity, efficiency, and creativity to your fingertips.


Key Features:

  1. AI-Powered Frame-to-Code Generation: Instantly convert any design frame into clean, production-ready code with the help of advanced AI. Say goodbye to manual handoffs and hello to seamless development workflows.


  1. Built-in Browser for Live HTML & CSS Preview: No need for third-party editors! Test and preview your code directly within Figma—experience real-time rendering of your designs without switching tools.


  1. One-Click Core Components: Effortlessly create simple, reusable UI components with just a click. Save time and maintain consistency across your designs.


  1. Comprehensive Icon Library: Access a vast library of high-quality icons and add them to your designs with just one click. Simplify your workflow and enhance your projects effortlessly.


  1. Professional Image Mock-up Integration: Search and filter through a curated collection of professional-quality mock-up images. Bring your designs to life by embedding realistic mock-ups directly into your Figma canvas.


SparkUI is more than just a plugin—it's your AI-powered design assistant, helping you focus on creativity while automating the tedious tasks. Transform your design workflow today with SparkUI.

plugins.name: GeneXus Design Assistant
plugins.description:
GeneXus Design Assistant is a revolutionary Figma plugin that seamlessly integrates with GeneXus using Generative Artificial Intelligence, allowing you to accelerate and optimize the application design process. With GeneXus Design Assistant, you can generate a fully functional application, leveraging the modeling capabilities and the power of GeneXus and GeneXus Next.


Optimizing the design process


GeneXus Design Assistant is aimed at designers who want to turn vibrant ideas into cutting-edge digital products without requiring programming skills.


The benefits include:


🚀 Rapid Prototyping and Testing: Quickly validate assumptions, explore alternatives, and develop functional MVPs, leveraging the robust capabilities of Generative Artificial Intelligence models, modeling in Figma, and GeneXus.


✨ Improved Communication and Collaboration: Designs and ideas are shared in real-time throughout the company, aligning interdisciplinary considerations into a shared vision of success.


🛠️ Scalable and Maintainable Solutions: Facilitates responding to the exact needs of a constantly evolving business environment, all through a unified and future-proof platform.


📱 Democratization of Design: Reduces bottlenecks by involving non-specialized team members at various project levels, fostering innovation, and streamlining workflows.


What is the GeneXus Design Assistant project?


GeneXus Design Assistant is a public Figma plugin, serving as an innovative assistant for application design. With GeneXus Design Assistant, designers can expedite the collaborative creation of software experiences, keeping a keen focus on end users. Functioning as a comprehensive assistant within Figma, GeneXus Design Assistant guides designers through the process of conceptualizing, designing, and prototyping web and mobile applications using Generative Artificial Intelligence.


GeneXus Design Assistant makes this possible by generating design from a data model and example data, both sourced from a GeneXus knowledge base, and utilizing a predefined, customizable design system. The generated design has the advantage of being importable into GeneXus, ensuring a seamless integration with the platform and allowing the creative process to easily translate into a functional software product.


USAGE


Please refer to GeneXus Design Assistant for Figma.


SUPPORT


Your thoughts, ideas, and suggestions for improvement are welcome and highly valued. Connect with us at GeneXus Support.

accepted.name: GeneXus DesignOps Team
accepted.description: GeneXus workspace specialized in integrating design into GeneXus knowledge base.

plugins.tagline: Plugin that seamlessly integrates with GeneXus using Generative Artificial Intelligence

plugins.description:
Droplette is an AI-powered palette generator for Figma & FigJam that lets you sync your styles and colors to generate countless palette combinations.


Select from your frames

Grab some frames and Droplette will extract colors. The AI will use use these a basis for creating your unique palettes.


Sync with your styles

Sync your color styles with Droplette to inform the AI what colors it can work with, helping you keep on brand and on track.


Adjust as you go

Like your palette but want to tweak it? No problem. Adjust your generated palette to suit your needs with built-in color adjustment controls.


Redo with AI

Iterate on your palette as much as you like. Suggest colors to take forward or start again from scratch.


-------


To learn more, check out -> droplette.app


Droplette requires an API key from OpenAI to operate. Droplette is available for a one time fee.

plugins.name: Figma to Svelte
plugins.description:
The Figma to Svelte plugin is designed to seamlessly generate Svelte code for the Deskblocks design system. It converts selected Figma frames into Svelte code instantly, automatically importing the necessary components from the Deskblocks library.


Key Features

  1. Effortless Code Generation: Converts Figma frames into Svelte code that is ready to use in your Zoho Desk extension project.
  2. Built-in Theming: Deskblocks handles appearance settings (light and dark mode), themes (blue, red, green, orange, yellow), and font selections (Puvi, Lato, Roboto)—"it just works."
  3. AI-Powered Refinement: Optionally use the Claude 3.5 Haiku model to refine the generated code into production-ready quality.


How to Use

  1. Select the Figma frame you want to convert.
  2. Run the plugin to instantly generate Svelte code for the selected frame.
  3. (Optional) Add your Anthropic API key to enable production-ready code generation using Claude 3.5 Haiku.

The generated code is ready to copy and paste into your Zoho Desk extension.


Key Guidelines

  1. Component Naming: Keep the original component names to ensure proper functionality, as the plugin relies on these names for performance.
  2. Autolayout Usage: Use autolayout instead of static frames for better responsive CSS translation.
  3. Radio Button Grouping: Group radio buttons in a separate autolayout (excluding the header) to ensure proper linking in the generated code.


AI Integration

The plugin leverages AI for advanced code refinement. The Claude 3.5 Haiku model is both fast and cost-effective, producing high-quality, production-ready code.

  1. Secure and Local: Your Anthropic API key is stored locally, ensuring privacy and security.
  2. Affordable: Claude 3.5 Haiku costs just $1 per million tokens, making it highly cost-effective—a $10 can support extensive usage.


Note

This is the initial version of the plugin and may have some limitations. Future updates will address these. If you encounter any issues or have suggestions, feel free to provide feedback.
plugins.tagline: Generate clean Svelte code from your Figma files, fully integrated with the Deskblocks design system

  3. Delete Components: Remove unwanted instances with a single click.


Note: Scanning may take a moment for larger files—thank you for your patience!
110968.tagline: Quickly find and navigate your imported components.

plugins.name: Figma to Storyblok
plugins.description:
Figma to Storyblok bridges the gap between design and content management. With just one click, you can export Figma components directly into your Storyblok space, instantly turning them into ready-to-use content blocks.


How to use the Figma to Storyblok Sync plugin:


1. Install the plugin 

Once installed, click Get Started in Figma, go through our onboarding slider, and click Connect Account in the final step.


2. Connect your account 

Use your Personal Access Token, generated in your Storyblok account, to enable a secure and seamless integration.


3. Export from Figma to Storyblok 

Select and export one frame at a time. In Storyblok, each frame becomes a universal block you can use as a component, with an auto-updated image preview.


Have feedback or need help?

Contact us at figma@storyblok.com
